ranked_diseases.explanation: 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome, also known as DiGeorge Syndrome, is commonly associated with cleft palate, intellectual disability, and global developmental delay, which aligns well with the patient's features.
Although primarily known for craniofacial abnormalities, Treacher Collins Syndrome can include cleft palate. Intellectual disability and developmental delay can also be present in some patients.
This syndrome is characterized by intellectual disability, developmental delay, and can include cleft features, which could relate to the patient's symptoms.
Kabuki Syndrome may present with cleft palate, intellectual disability, and global developmental delay, although it is less commonly manifested than in higher-ranked possibilities.
CHARGE Syndrome can present with cleft palate, intellectual disability, and developmental delay. It is a possibility, although phenotypic overlap is more limited than higher-ranked diseases.
